item.title: Janisu-chan add a quote by Stephenie Meyer
item.description: "He's like a drug for you, Bella." -- Stephenie Meyer

item.title: Janisu-chan add a quote by Shannon Hale
item.description: "I think the only way to get through this life is laughing hard and constantly, mostly at myself." -- Shannon Hale

item.title: Janisu-chan add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "Life is pain, highness. Anyone who says differently is selling something." -- William Goldman

item.title: Janisu-chan add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "I ask not for any crown But that which all may win; Nor try to conquer any world Except the one within." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Janisu-chan add a quote by Laura Ingalls Wilder
item.description: "I am beginning to learn that it is the sweet, simple things of life which are the real ones after all." -- Laura Ingalls Wilder

item.title: Janisu-chan add a quote by Walter M. Miller Jr.
item.description: "You don’t <i>have</i> a soul, Doctor. You <i>are</i> a soul. You <i>have</i> a body, temporarily." -- Walter M. Miller Jr.

item.title: Janisu-chan add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Janisu-chan add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Janisu-chan add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "There are only two kinds of people in the end: those who say to God, "Thy will be done," and those to whom God says, in the end, "Thy will be done." All that are in Hell, choose it. Without that self-choice there could be no Hell. No soul that seriously and constantly desires joy will ever miss it. Those who seek find. Those who knock it is opened." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Janisu-chan add a quote by Gail Carson Levine
item.description: "Drualt took Freya's warm hand, Her strong hand, Her sword hand, And pressed it to his lips, Pressed it to his heart. Come with me,' he said. Come with me to battle, My love. Tarry at my side. Stay with me When battle is done. Tarry at my side. Laugh with me, And walk with me The long, long way. Tarry with me, My love, at my side." -- Gail Carson Levine

item.title: Janisu-chan add a quote by Kathryn Smith
item.description: "The only thing a person can never have too much of is common sense." -- Kathryn Smith

item.title: Janisu-chan add a quote by Ann Brashares
item.description: "There are two kinds of people in this world. The kind who divide the world into two kinds of people and those who don't." -- Ann Brashares

item.title: Janisu-chan add a quote by Sheri L. Dew
item.description: "Thus, when we plead for the gift of charity, we aren't asking for lovely feelings toward someone who bugs us or someone who has injured or wounded us. We are actually pleading for our very natures to be changed, for our character and disposition to become more and more like the Savior's, so that we literally feel as He would feel and thus do what He would do." -- Sheri L. Dew

item.title: Janisu-chan add a quote by L.J. Smith
item.description: "You don't love a girl because of beauty. You love her because she sings a song only you can understand." -- L.J. Smith

item.title: Janisu-chan add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Ah! There is nothing like staying at home, for real comfort." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Janisu-chan add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Angry people are not always wise." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Janisu-chan add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description:
"I can listen no longer in silence. I must speak to you by such means as are within my reach. You pierce my soul. I am half agony, half hope. Tell me not that I am too late, that such precious feelings are gone for ever. I offer myself to you again with a heart even more your own than when you almost broke it, eight years and a half ago. Dare not say that man forgets sooner than woman, that his love has an earlier death. I have loved none but you. Unjust I may have been, weak and resentful I have been, but never inconstant. You alone have brought me to Bath. For you alone, I think and plan. Have you not seen this? Can you fail to have understood my wishes? I had not waited even these ten days, could I have read your feelings, as I think you must have penetrated mine. I can hardly write. I am every instant hearing something which overpowers me. You sink your voice, but I can distinguish the tones of that voice when they would be lost on others. Too good, too excellent creature! You do us justice, indeed. You do believe that there is true attachment and constancy among men. Believe it to be most fervent, most undeviating, in F. W.
I must go, uncertain of my fate; but I shall return hither, or follow your party, as soon as possible. A word, a look, will be enough to decide whether I enter your father's house this evening or never." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Janisu-chan add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Nothing ever fatigues me, but doing what I do not like." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Janisu-chan add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "but for my own part, if a book is well written, I always find it too short." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Janisu-chan add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "It isn't what we say or think that defines us, but what we do." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Janisu-chan add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I have now been married ten years. I know what it is to live entirely for and with what I love best on earth. I hold myself supremely blest - blest beyond what language can express; because I am my husband's life as fully as he is mine. No woman was ever nearer to her mate than I am: ever more absolutely bone of his bone and flesh of his flesh. I know no weariness of my Edward's society: he knows none of mine, any more than we each do the pulsation of the heart that beats in our separate bosoms; consequently, we are ever together. To be together is for us to be at once free as in solitude, as gay as in company. We talk, I believe, all day long: to talk to each other is but more animated and an audible thinking. All my confidence is bestowed on him, all his confidence is devoted to me; we are precisely suited in character - perfect concord is the result." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Janisu-chan add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Janisu-chan add a quote by Desmond Tutu
item.description: "Do your little bit of good where you are; it's those little bits of good put together that overwhelm the world." -- Desmond Tutu

item.title: Janisu-chan add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "Life is just like an old time rail journey ... delays, sidetracks, smoke, dust, cinders, and jolts, interspersed only occasionally by beautiful vistas and thrilling bursts of speed. The trick is to thank the Lord for letting you have the ride." -- Gordon B. Hinckley
